title: Justtoons
author: Justtoons
content: If Bitcoin becoming a mainstream payment system in the future there will be no banks controlling our money ,and the ideal of faster more cheap international payment will be more interesting . imagine  sending money to someone with out any fees ,well it will mainly reduce the government control over citizen ,but  first bitcoin most become known to the world .so what are your taught on this topic

comments.author: Botnake
comments.body: Quote from: Justtoons on January 05, 2025, 09:36:30 PMIf Bitcoin becoming a mainstream payment system in the future there will be no banks controlling our money ,and the ideal of faster more cheap international payment will be more interesting . imagine  sending money to someone with out any fees ,well it will mainly reduce the government control over citizen ,but  first bitcoin most become known to the world .so what are your taught on this topic I don’t think it will ever happen, because the fact that governments are regulating crypto in general makes it highly unlikely that banks will disappear and be replaced by Bitcoin. From the start, Bitcoin’s purpose was decentralization on all transactions, but that’s not what we see now. Most exchanges are centralized, while decentralized ones aren’t as popular. This shows that governments still hold the power to protect their interests.I’d rather be content with Bitcoin’s limited adoption as a payment system. Governments are already working on their own digital currencies, like  CBDCs, because they always want to maintain control over the financial system.

comments.author: Alone055
comments.body: Quote from: Justtoons on January 05, 2025, 09:36:30 PMIf Bitcoin becoming a mainstream payment system in the future there will be no banks controlling our money ,and the ideal of faster more cheap international payment will be more interesting . imagine  sending money to someone with out any fees ,well it will mainly reduce the government control over citizen ,but  first bitcoin most become known to the world .so what are your taught on this topic We need to understand and accept the fact that Bitcoin cannot completely replace the current monetary system because it's not only the people who are using fiat currencies and banks for their financial activities; how do you think governments and countries will manage everything with an unstable currency? A country having reserves in Bitcoin will always be in danger of losing value for its reserves if the price falls, which we know happens.So, even if Bitcoin becomes globally accepted as a payment method, fiat currencies and current financial institutions will still be around. It will just be your choice for when you want to use them and when you don't. If you, as an individual, don't need them at all, you can abandon their services and use cryptocurrencies for all your financial activities if you know it's possible.And, even for that to happen, we will need to wait for years and decades, because it won't be easy for all governments to let that happen, and without all countries accepting and allowing it, it won't be a global thing.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: It's not possible to send some bitcoin without fee. Transaction fees are important because it will serve as the reward for miners. A country where bitcoin is used as a mainstream payment method will only happen when the government will make bitcoin as a legal tender then it would be possible but if isn't then it won't be possible. Government will always find a way to be able to earn profit without making bitcoin as a legal tender so it's not likely that it will happen in the future.

comments.author: EFS
comments.body: Bitcoin is already mainstream, many people have an idea of what it is. But it would be delusional to think that Bitcoin will replace the entire banking system. Bitcoin can only be an alternative payment system, which is currently possible. You can send money all over the world, you don't need banks. This doesn't mean that the whole banking sector will disappear and crypto currencies will be the only option.

comments.author: Hazink
comments.body: Bitcoin transactions can't run without a fee; there will always be a fee for Bitcoin transactions. It's been so, and it will always be so; it will even get higher in time to come, and sometimes it will reduce too. We have experienced it in the past. Banks control over our funds is our decision to make; we can either use them or avoid using them. The choice is entirely ours, which people are already making.Bitcoin can’t completely take over the banking sector; they both need each other in some areas. Some people will still want to remain traditional, and you can’t force them to embrace what they don’t believe in.

However, for us to achieve a world where Bitcoin will be the only means of transaction it's certain that everybody will be a Bitcoin holder which may likely not be possible.

comments.author: Text
comments.body: You're right before Bitcoin becomes mainstream it must first achieve widespread recognition, acceptance, and understanding. Who wouldn’t want fast and affordable transactions right? Add to that the freedom to control our own money. But there are risks involved that Bitcoin currently cannot address especially those we are accustomed to in traditional systems. Imagine if banks disappeared how would security and fraud prevention work in a decentralized setup? And if government control were reduced how would regulations and anti-money laundering efforts be managed? This is why the world isn't quite ready for such a fundamental shift yet.

comments.author: romero121
comments.body: The monetary system that's been followed all around the world has a big history. It can't be easily vanished with the innovation that existed around 15 years back. Slowly people get used to it, for which we can't say that the people have left the traditional system and moved to the bitcoin usage. In most parts of the world, digital growth has happened in recent years, and the same has popularized bitcoin. Banks are the major functional units of the government. Banks getting out of usage and bitcoin taking the role won't happen. This is kind of a government functioning as a puppet. No government wishes to have such a role. Bitcoin might go mainstream, but the main purpose for which it has been innovated has got transformed towards a form of investment. If the specific purpose is fulfilled, it might make a big change in the entire system.

comments.author: cryptomaniac_xxx
comments.body: Quote from: Justtoons on January 05, 2025, 09:36:30 PMIf Bitcoin becoming a mainstream payment system in the future there will be no banks controlling our money ,and the ideal of faster more cheap international payment will be more interesting . imagine  sending money to someone with out any fees ,well it will mainly reduce the government control over citizen ,but  first bitcoin most become known to the world .so what are your taught on this topic Nah, it's not going to happen, banks are still one of the institutions of any nation, it's one of the pillars so I doubt that they will just become obsolete because of Bitcoin. And we have discussed this so many times already that we say that we should take advantage of both worlds. Having some kind of money in a bank is good and then we have our investment in Bitcoin in a wallet that we have total control of.And then for the unbank, and for sure there are millions around the world, Bitcoin can be their leverage if they can get a banking account. As for Bitcoin being known in the world, it's going to be a slow process but we are getting there. The good thing is that anyone can used Bitcoin as payment scheme across the world as you describe and to be used like a remittance, that will be the best case scenario for BTC.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Bitcoin has already a price, there's no way to send Bitcoin without fees, unlike in the beginning. I think it's better if you elaborate your words first, what's actually the "mainstream payment system", is it only for international payment or daily usage? because your next words is talking about international payment.If it's only international payment, banks is still needed.However, if it's daily usage, it's better if you start to use Bitcoin for daily usage in your country, to prove if Bitcoin is better than other currency.

comments.author: B-BossMan
comments.body: Quote from: Justtoons on January 05, 2025, 09:36:30 PMIf Bitcoin becoming a mainstream payment system in the future there will be no banks controlling our money ,and the ideal of faster more cheap international payment will be more interesting . imagine  sending money to someone with out any fees ,well it will mainly reduce the government control over citizen ,but  first bitcoin most become known to the world .so what are your taught on this topic Even if  bitcoin is massively adopted by Government, it will never take over our traditional transactions, Satoshi Nakamoto created bitcoin as an alternative method of payment that will throw out middlemen from examining our transactions and deciding when we will have access to our money in the financial institution and not totally mainstream the traditional transaction in any country that bitcoin is accepted as a means of payment. So the use of our currency and bitcoin will work hand in hand in paying for transactions in any country because there are some transactions that you can't possibly pay with bitcoin because of how small the money is, and then you can use some other currency to pay for the transaction. For instance, when you want to pay for a transaction of very small amounts, you will easily use some traditional method of transactions like in Nigeria,Ghana,Benin republic,cameron and Qatar to pay for that transaction because you know if you use bitcoin, it will cost you more because of the transaction fee.In addition we can force any individual to use bitcoin but when changes arise from investors and holders they will accept the bitcoin massively.

comments.author: Dzwaafu11
comments.body: Quote from: Justtoons on January 05, 2025, 09:36:30 PMIf Bitcoin becoming a mainstream payment system in the future there will be no banks controlling our money ,and the ideal of faster more cheap international payment will be more interesting . imagine  sending money to someone with out any fees ,well it will mainly reduce the government control over citizen ,but  first bitcoin most become known to the world .so what are your taught on this topic Bitcoin is already known to the world, but it will be impossible for bitcoin to replace the local currency, for the fact that governments are the ones to implement it, and since they already know that they will not have control over the money, they won’t accept that. However, everybody already knows that bitcoin is just an alternative way of transaction. Thinking of making it mainstream that will replace the local currency is something that everybody knows will not happen regardless of its adoption; furthermore, many people have been used to the local currency, so if they tell those people to go back to using bitcoin, it will cause another problem for them. Seriously, many of these people don’t even go to school in some local areas, and obviously these people cannot make transactions with bitcoin. So there is not the possibility of bitcoin replacing the local currency that is controlled and printed by the government.
